What is the purpose of the `getaddressbalance` command in Verus?
The `getaddressbalance` command returns the balance for one or more addresses. It requires the `addressindex` to be enabled.

getaddressbalance Returns the balance for an address(es) (requires addressindex to be enabled). Arguments: {  "addresses"   [    "address" (string) The base58check encoded address    ,...   ]  "friendlynames" (boolean) Include additional array of friendly names keyed by currency i-addresses } Result: {  "balance" (number) The current balance in satoshis  "received" (number) The total number of satoshis received (including change) } Examples: > verus getaddressbalance '{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddressbalance", "params": [{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getaddressbalance
What are the arguments required for the `getaddressbalance` command?

The `getaddressbalance` command takes two arguments: 
1. `addresses`: an array of base58check encoded addresses.
2. `friendlynames` (optional): a boolean indicating whether to include additional friendly names keyed by currency i-addresses.

getaddressbalance Returns the balance for an address(es) (requires addressindex to be enabled). Arguments: {  "addresses"   [    "address" (string) The base58check encoded address    ,...   ]  "friendlynames" (boolean) Include additional array of friendly names keyed by currency i-addresses } Result: {  "balance" (number) The current balance in satoshis  "received" (number) The total number of satoshis received (including change) } Examples: > verus getaddressbalance '{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddressbalance", "params": [{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getaddressbalance
What information does the `getaddressbalance` command return?

The `getaddressbalance` command returns an object with two properties:
1. `balance`: the current balance in satoshis.
2. `received`: the total number of satoshis received (including change).

getaddressbalance Returns the balance for an address(es) (requires addressindex to be enabled). Arguments: {  "addresses"   [    "address" (string) The base58check encoded address    ,...   ]  "friendlynames" (boolean) Include additional array of friendly names keyed by currency i-addresses } Result: {  "balance" (number) The current balance in satoshis  "received" (number) The total number of satoshis received (including change) } Examples: > verus getaddressbalance '{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddressbalance", "params": [{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I use the `getaddressbalance` command to get the balance of an address using the command line?

You can use the `getaddressbalance` command to get the balance of an address using the command line by running the following command:
```
verus getaddressbalance '{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}'
```
Replace `RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87` with the address you want to check.

getaddressbalance Returns the balance for an address(es) (requires addressindex to be enabled). Arguments: {  "addresses"   [    "address" (string) The base58check encoded address    ,...   ]  "friendlynames" (boolean) Include additional array of friendly names keyed by currency i-addresses } Result: {  "balance" (number) The current balance in satoshis  "received" (number) The total number of satoshis received (including change) } Examples: > verus getaddressbalance '{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getaddressbalance", "params": [{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

How can I use the `getaddressbalance` command to get the balance of an address using a JSON-RPC request?

You can use the `getaddressbalance` command to get the balance of an address using a JSON-RPC request by sending a POST request to `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the following JSON data:
```
{
  "jsonrpc": "1.0",
  "id": "curltest",
  "method": "getaddressbalance",
  "params": [{"addresses": ["RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87"]}]
}
```
Replace `RY5LccmGiX9bUHYGtSWQouNy1yFhc5rM87` with the address you want to check.
